Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
January \Jan"u*a*ry\, n. [L. Januarius, fr. Janus an old Latin deity, the god of the sun and the year, to whom the month of January was sacred; cf. janua a door, Skr. y[=a] to go.] The first month of the year, containing thirty-one days. [1913 Webster]
Note: Before the adoption of New Style, the commencement of the year was usually reckoned from March 25. [1913 Webster]
January n : the first month of the year; begins 10 days after the winter solstice [syn: {Jan}]
